title: Zac Cini
text:
Zac Cini (born 24 May 2000) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a or er for the <a href="Cronulla%20Sharks">Cronulla Sharks</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
Background.
Cini was born in <a href="Sydney%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Sydney</a> and is of Maltese descent.
Cini played his junior rugby league for the Minchinbury Jets. He later said, "I grew up supporting the Tigers. I loved <a href="Benji%20Marshall">Benji</a> in 2005 and I used to sit in the lounge room watching him on TV. When he played the grand final I was five and I used to go out into the yard and try to practise the Benji step."
Playing career.
Early career.
Cini came through the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> junior system playing in their <a href="SG%20Ball%20Cup">SG Ball</a> championship winning team of 2018, he was educated at <a href="St%20Dominic%27s%20College%2C%20Penrith">St Dominic's College, Penrith</a> where he made the <a href="Australian%20Schoolboys%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Schoolboys rugby league team</a> in that same year.
2021.
Cini was named to his debut in round 8 for the Tigers, starting on the wing against the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra Dragons</a> away at <a href="WIN%20Stadium">WIN Stadium</a>. At the time he was leading the lower <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a> competition in post-contact metres, tackle breaks, runs and run metres. He scored a try and had another disallowed as he "starred" in his first game. He said after the match, "I got about 20 tickets for family and my mates organised a bus. I think there was about 50 of them that jumped on the bus and sat in that corner. You could definitely hear them. It is a dream just to play footy but to score on debut with my mates in that corner, just the support they gave was awesome and made it 10 times better." <a href="The%20Sydney%20Morning%20Herald">The Sydney Morning Herald</a> said, "The flying mullet man from Minchinbury, a mad Wests Tigers fan, became an instant cult hero."
Cini played a total of four matches for the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> in the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> as the club finished 13th and missed the finals.
